intro: Hieracium arnassense, commonly known as Arnassian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and sunny exposures. Its leaves are generally lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium arnassense is often found in rocky or grassy areas and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
